title: World-Beating South Korea Stocks Still ‘Cheap’, First Eagle Says
description: South Korean equities remain attractive despite a record-breaking rally, with a corporate reform drive modeled on Japan’s playbook seen delivering faster gains for shareholders, according to First Eagle Investment Management.
content: South Korean equities remain attractive despite a record-breaking rally, with a corporate reform drive modeled on Japan’s playbook seen delivering faster gains for shareholders, according to First Eagle Investment Management.
